Name: Honolulu Cocktail No.2
Ingredients: 10 ml Chilled water omit if using wet ice
1 dash Orange Bitters by Angostura optional
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Nick & Nora glass .
Prepare garnish of skewered Luxardo Maraschino Cherry .
Review: Originally made with equal parts gin, Bénédictine and maraschino but better balanced with a tad more gin. (If making with equal parts this is a slightly sweet old-school after-dinner cocktail is best served on-the-rocks.)
History: The Honolulu appears in Hugo R Ensslin's 1917 Recipes for Mixed Drinks but is better known and gained its "No.2" moniker when repeated by Harry Craddock in his 1930 The Savoy Cocktail Book .
Nutrition: One serving of Honolulu Cocktail No.2 contains 129 calories
